de.tudarmstadt.ukp.dkpro.core.api.segmentation.type

Class Token

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.uima.cas.impl.FeatureStructureImplC

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, org.apache.uima.cas.AnnotationBaseFS, org.apache.uima.cas.FeatureStructure, org.apache.uima.cas.impl.AnnotationBaseImpl, org.apache.uima.cas.impl.AnnotationImpl, org.apache.uima.cas.impl.FeatureStructureImpl, org.apache.uima.cas.text.AnnotationFS
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JapaneseToken

    public class Token
extends org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation

    Token is one of the two types commonly produced by a segmenter (the other being Sentence). A Token usually represents a word, although it may be used to represent multiple tightly connected words (e.g. "New York") or parts of a word (e.g. the possessive "'s"). One may choose to split compound words into multiple tokens, e.g. ("CamelCase" -> "Camel", "Case"; "Zauberstab" -> "Zauber", "stab"). Most processing components operate on Tokens, usually within the limits of the surrounding Sentence. E.g. a part-of-speech tagger analyses each Token in a Sentence and assigns a part-of-speech to each Token.

    Updated by JCasGen Sun Jan 28 11:38:37 CET 2018 XML source: /Users/bluefire/git/dkpro-core/dkpro-core-api-segmentation-asl/src/main/resources/desc/type/LexicalUnits_customized.xml

      • getParent

        public org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation getParent()
        getter for parent - gets the parent of this token. This feature is meant to be used in when the token participates in a constituency parse and then refers to a constituent containing this token. The type of this feature is Annotation to avoid adding a dependency on the syntax API module.
        Returns:
        value of the feature

      • setParent

        public void setParent(org.apache.uima.jcas.tcas.Annotation v)
        setter for parent - sets the parent of this token. This feature is meant to be used in when the token participates in a constituency parse and then refers to a constituent containing this token. The type of this feature is Annotation to avoid adding a dependency on the syntax API module.
        Parameters:
        v - value to set into the feature

        public String getId()

      • getText

        public String getText()
        Returns:
        the token text taking into account a TokenForm annotation that might exist.

      • setText

        public void setText(String aText)
        Set the token text. Depending on whether the text is different to the covered text a TokenForm annotation is created or not. This method can only be used if the document text has already been set. If a document text is constructed incrementally, setForm(TokenForm) has to be called manually and whether or not a form is necessary needs to be determined based on the current state of the document text being built.
        Parameters:
        aText - the token text.
